tgt_text: nanomanje senganywe yicovid19, sikhonile kwenta tinchubekelembili letinyenti etintfweni tetfu letinyenti letibekwa embili.

src_text: despite the dominance of covid19, we have still managed to make advances in several of our key priorities.
tgt_text: ngesikhatsi setfu, indzawo yelivekati laseafrika yekuhwebelana mahhala (iafcfta) yagcina yetfuliwe, yahambela embili sikhatsi lesisha setekuhwebelana kwemave aseafrika neku hlanganiswa kwemnotfo.

src_text: during our term, the africa continental free trade area (afcfta) was finally launched, heralding a new era of intraafrican trade and economic integration.
tgt_text: ngisho nangaphasi kwetimo letimatima letivetwe ngulolubhubhane, lelivekati lichubekele embili emgomeni 'wekuthulisa tibhamu' kulelivekati.

src_text: even under the difficult conditions posed by the pandemic, the continent has pushed ahead with towards the goal of ‘silencing the guns’ on the continent.
tgt_text: iau beyiloku ihlanganyela ngemandla kutikhuluniswano tekucela nekubonisana mayelana negrand ethiopian renaissance dam, macondzana nekuce dvwa kwekudubulana eli bya nekukhutsata kuthula esouth sudan.

src_text: the au has been actively involved in negotiations around the grand ethiopian renaissance dam, in achieving a ceasefire in libya and promoting peace in south sudan.
tgt_text: lokukugcile kwelicembu letfu kube sekuhlomiseni bomake ngetemnotfo, lesitawuchubeka nekuhola ngisho nangemuva kwekuphela kwesikhatsi setfu kute futsi kube sekupheleni kweminyakalishumi wekufakwa kwetetimali nete mnotfo tabomake ku2030.

src_text: another focus of our term has been on the economic empowerment of women, which we will continue to champion even beyond our term and throughout the decade of african women’s financial and economic inclusion to 2030. as we hand over the baton to the democratic republic of congo (drc) we leave this preeminent continental body in a position of greater strength.
tgt_text: lapho sinika idemocratic republic of congo (idrc) tintsambo sishiya lomtimba welivekati lovelele esimeni lesinemandla kakhulu.

src_text: south africa will continue to play its part to foster integration on the continent, and support the incoming chair and the organisation in its efforts to meet the aspirations of the au’s agenda 2063. when the organisation for african unity was founded in 1963, member states planted the seeds of cooperation and solidarity in pursuit of a better life for all the peoples of africa.
tgt_text: iningizimu afrika itawuchubeka idlale indzima yayo kwenta kuhlangana kulelivekati, kanye nekwesekela sihlalo longenako kanye nalenhlangano emitameni yayo yekuhlangabetana netimfuno teajenda yeau yanga2063.

src_text: they affirmed that african unity was paramount if the welfare and wellbeing of africa’s people was to be assured.
tgt_text: ngesikhatsi kusungu lwa inhlangano yebunye beafrika nga1963, emave langemalunga ahlanyela inhlanyelo yelubanjiswano nebunye ngenhloso ye mphilo lencono yabo bonkhe bantfu baseafrika.

src_text: history bears witness that these seeds have not always fallen on fertile ground, and over the years the continental unity project has experienced many hurdles and false starts.
tgt_text: bacinisekisa kutsi bunye beafrika bebubaluleke ka khulu uma ngabe inhlala kahle nekuphila kahle kwe bantfu beafrika bekufanele kutsi kucinisekiswe.

src_text: but the grave threat posed by this pandemic has galvanised african countries to collective action.
tgt_text: umlandvo ungufakazi wekutsi lenhlanyelo beyingaweli emhlabatsini lovundzile ngaso sonkhe sikhatsi, futsi ekuhambeni kweminyaka umklamo webunye beafrika uhlangabetene netinkinga letinyenti kanye nekucala lokungasilo liciniso.

src_text: in the hothouse of the covid19 crisis, the seeds of unity and cooperation planted by our pioneering forebears have come to life and flourished.
tgt_text: kepha kwesabisa ngekufa lokuvetwe ngulolubhubhane lwente emave aseafrika ku tsi asebente ngekubambi sana.

src_text: this time of great trial and difficulty has been among the au’s finest hours.
tgt_text: ngesikhatsi lesimatima kakhulu secovid19, lenhlanyelo yebunye ne lubanjiswano leyahlanye lwa ngemavulandlela etfu aphambilini seyimilile futsi iyandlondlobala.

src_text: we are honoured to have been given the opportunity to lead the organisation through this period, when it practically demonstrated the true meaning of the words african union.
tgt_text: ngalesikhatsi lesi sekuli ngwa lokukhulu nebuma tima sibe sikhatsi lesihle kakhulu seau.

src_text: this is an accomplishment for which all the citizens of our continent africa should feel proud and from which they should draw encouragement.
tgt_text: kuligugu lelikhulu kuhola inhlangano yebunye bemave aseafrika vukuzenzele unnamed sikhatsi seningi zimu afrika se kuba ngusihlalo wenhlangano yebunye bemave aseafrika (iau) sesifike ekugcineni.

src_text: steps to revive the economy vukuzenzele unnamed it will soon be a year since the first reported case of coronavirus disease (covid19) in our country.
tgt_text: tinyatselo tekuvuselela umnotfo vukuzenzele unnamed sekutawuhlangana umnyaka solo kwavakala indzaba yekucala ngeligciwane lekhorona eveni letfu.

src_text: the pandemic has come at a great cost to both public health and the livelihoods of millions of our people.
tgt_text: lolubhubhane lute nomona kalo lomkhulu kutemphilo temphakatsi nakutindlela tekutiphilisa tetinkhulu ngwane tebantfu bakitsi.

src_text: many workers lost part of their income as their work hours were reduced with many being retrenched.
tgt_text: basebenti labanyenti balahlekelwa yincenye yemiholo njengoba emahora abo ekusebenta anci shiswa, kwatsi labanyenti badzilitwa.

src_text: several businesses have incurred heavy losses from scaledback operations.
tgt_text: emabhizinisi lamanyenti alahlekelwa kamatima ngenca yekumiswa kwaleminye imisebenti yawo.

src_text: others have had to close.
tgt_text: lamanye kwadzi ngeka kutsi avale.

src_text: people working in the informal sector have also suffered.
tgt_text: bantfu labasebenta kumkhakha longashayelwa umtsetfo nabo batsintseka.

src_text: most difficult of all, the pandemic has claimed the lives of breadwinners in many families, leaving them destitute and fearful for the future.
tgt_text: lokulukhuni kunako konkhe, lolubhubhane lutsetse timphilo talabo labebabondli emindenini le minyenti, basala sebaswela kakhulu, baba nekwesaba ngelikusasa.

src_text: this is why the extensive relief measures we put in place were both necessary and urgent.
tgt_text: kungakonje letinyatselo tekusita letiluliwe lesiti tsatsile betisidzingo futsi tiphutfuma.

src_text: and, now that nearly a year has passed, we can say that these measures have proved effective.
tgt_text: manje, lokutsi cishe sekundlule umnyaka, singasho sitsi letinyatselo kuyabonakala kutsi tisebentile.

src_text: of the full package of relief measures that we introduced, perhaps the two measures that had the greatest impact were the special covid19 social relief of distress grant and the unemployment insurance fund's (uif) covid19 temporary employer/employee relief scheme, generally known as covid ters.
tgt_text: kulenhlanganisela yeti ndlela telusito lesitetfulile, mhlawumbe tinyatselo letimbili letibe nesisindvo lesikhulu bekuyimali lekhetsekile yesibonelelo secovid19 kanye nesikimu seuif secovid19 sesikhashana sekubonelela umcashi nemsebenti, ngalokutayelekile lesatiwa ngekutsi yicovid ters.

src_text: we would not have been able to roll out these measures in such a short space of time if we had not had an extensive social security infrastructure already in place.
tgt_text: besingeke sikwati kuniketela ngalolusito kulesi khashana lesincane kube be kungekho kuphepha kwe sakhiwoncanti emphaka tsini.

src_text: we were able to respond to this huge and immediate need in our society thanks to the substantial nationwide infrastructure and systems of the south african social security agency and the uif.
tgt_text: sikwatile kuphendvula ngaphandle kwekucitsa sikhatsi kulesidzingo lesikhulu emmangweni, sibonga kuba khona kwesa khiwonchanti lesibaluleki le esiveni kanye netinhlelo teejensi yekucinisekiswa kwetenhlalakahle eni ngizimu afrika (isassa) kanye nesikhwama se mshwalense welabangasa sebenti (iuif).

src_text: there were certainly technical and other glitches along the way, but most of these were speedily resolved.
tgt_text: kusobala kutsi bekunetingcinamba ekusebenteni kanye nekutsikameteka endleleni, kodvwake leti nyenti takhona talungiswa masinyane.

src_text: these government agencies did outstanding work to enroll millions of new beneficiaries and ensure they were paid.
tgt_text: lamaejensi ahulumende ente umsebenti loncomekako weku bhalisa tinkhulungwane talabamele kuzuza taphi ndza tacinisekisa kutsi babhadelwe.

src_text: the support provided by the uif was a lifeline to struggling businesses and employees.
tgt_text: kusekela lokwentiwe yiuif kusite emabhizinisini labebukene nebuma tima nebasebenti.

src_text: it made the difference between companies remaining open and being forced to close, between jobs saved and jobs lost.
tgt_text: kwente umehluko phakatsi kwetinkapani letisele tivu liwe kanye naletiphoceleke kutsi tivalwe, naphakatsi kwemisebenti lehlengekile nalelahlekile.

src_text: this benefited businesses like sihle’s brew, a restaurant in gauteng, which was able to retain its 18 employees because of the ters scheme.
tgt_text: loku kuhlomulise ema bhizinisi lafana nesihle’s brew, indzawo yekudle la egauteng, lekhonile kugcina basebenti bayo labangu18 ngenca yeluhlelo leters.

src_text: thanks to government support, mamoshal agae trading and projects, an autoelectrical business in mokopane, was able to pay its workers as well as its rent and rates during the lockdown.
tgt_text: sibonga lusekelo lwahulumende, imamoshalagae trading and projects, libhizinisi letintfo tegezi lelisemokopane, likhonile kukho khela basebenti bayo kanye nerenti netinhlawulo tamasipala ngesikhatsi sekuvalwa kwelive.

src_text: employees in dire straits were able to receive a portion of their salaries.
tgt_text: basebenti labebasebumatimeni bakhonile kutfola libintana emiholweni yabo.

src_text: lindiwe ntuli, a paralegal in centurion, has told how receiving her benefits enabled her to work from home and be able to afford her rent.
tgt_text: lindiwe ntuli longu mmeli wemtsetfo wase centurion ebecoca ngekutsi kutfola kwakhe kusitakala kumente wakhona kusebentela ekhaya wakhona nekukhokhela irenti.

src_text: there are many stories of companies that have been able to stay afloat over the past year because of the support they received from the uif.
tgt_text: tinyenti tindzaba ngetinkapani letikhonile kubambelela kulomnyaka londlulile ngenca yelusito lolutfolakele kuuif.

src_text: the same can be said of the small businesses helped by the various grants and loans provided by a number of departments.
tgt_text: lokufanako kungashiwo nangemabhizinisi lama ncane lasitwe tibonelelo letehlukene nekubolekwa timali lokwentiwa matiko lahlukene.

src_text: these measures greatly helped our people in their time of need.
tgt_text: letinhlelo tibasite ka khulu bantfu bakitsi nga lesikhatsi bebadzinga sito.

src_text: as we transition from relief to recovery, we have to shift gear.
tgt_text: njengoba sisuka ekusitweni sintjintjela ekusima meni, kufanele sintjintje kwenta.

src_text: while these relief measures were designed to be temporary, the economy will continue to feel the effects of the pandemic for some time.
tgt_text: njengoba letinhlelo telusito betentelwe simo se sikhashana, umnotfo usa tochubeka kuva umtselela ngenca yalolubhubhane sikhatsi lesidze.

src_text: even as lockdown restrictions have been eased, many companies are struggling to cope with the fallout of months of diminished operations and lost revenue.
tgt_text: nanoma mikhawulo yekuvalwa kwelive icegisiwe, tinkapani letinyenti tisashikashika nekubukana nalokulahlekelwa tinyanga tekungasebenti nalokulahlekelwa ngumalingena.

src_text: it is for this reason that, following extensive discussion with social partners at the national economic development and labour council the covid ters benefit has been extended until 15 march 2021 for sectors that have not been able to fully operate.
tgt_text: kungalesizatfu kutsi, kulandzela kucocisana kabanti nabalingani lesisebentisana nabo kuned lac, kuzuza kwecovid ters kwelulelwe kuye ku15 indlovulenkhulu 2021 kumikhakha lengakakhoni kusebenta ngalokugcwele.

src_text: the special covid grant has been extended for another three months.
tgt_text: sibonelelo secovid19 lesikhetsekile selulwe ngaletinye tinyanga letintsatfu.

src_text: these remain shortterm measures.
tgt_text: letinyatselo leti tisala titesikhashane.

src_text: our focus now must be on creating an enabling environment for businesses to recover, and for economic growth that spurs job creation and attracts invest ment.
tgt_text: kunakisisa kwetfu nyalo kumele kube sekwakheni simondzawo lesivumako kutsi emabhizinisi avuseleleke, kanye nekukhula kwemnotfo lokudvundvu balisa kwakhiwa kwemi sebenti nalokuheha lutja lomali.

src_text: the recovery will be difficult and will take time, not least because we are still in the midst of the pandemic.
tgt_text: lokuvuseleleka kuta wuba lukhuni futsi kuta wutsatsa sikhatsi, loku ku bangwa kutsi sisasemkha tsini walolubhubhane.

src_text: important as these relief measures are now, we will not be able to sustain them indefinitely.
tgt_text: njengekubaluleka kwaletinyatselo tekulekelela nyalo, singeke sikwati kutigcina ngalokuchubekako.

src_text: we need to make sure that these relief measures provide a firm foundation for a broader recovery without driving the country deeper into debt.
tgt_text: sidzinga kucinisekisa kutsi letinyatselo telusito tiniketa sisekelo lesicinile sekuvuseleleka kabanti ngaphandle kwekuchubekisela live ekujuleni kwesikweleti.

src_text: unless we can bring our national debt down to sustainable levels no meaningful economic recovery will be possible.
tgt_text: ngaphandle kwekutsi sehlisele phansi emazingeni lalawulekako sikweleti setfu savelonkhe angeke sibe nekuvuseleleka kwemnotfo ngemphumelelo.

src_text: our national consciousness must now move beyond the realm of relief into that of recovery, and we must all be part of this effort.
tgt_text: lwati lwetfu silive nyalo kumele lusuke kulombuso wekusitwa lwendlulele kulona wekuvuseleleka, futsi kumele sonkhe sibe yincenye yalomzamo.

src_text: as government, hard decisions on public spending will need to be made and implemented this year.
tgt_text: njengahulumende, tincumo leticinile kunchitfomali yesive kumele tentiwe futsi ticaliswe kusentjetiswa kulomnyaka lona.

src_text: companies will need to be innovative in driving methods and processes that secure their sustainability and profitability, with job retention being their foremost consideration.
tgt_text: tinkapani kutawudzi ngeka kutsi tibe netindlela letinsha tekuphatsa neti nchubo leticinisa kusimama nenzuzo, kanye nekugcina umsebenti kube ngulokuphambili letikunakako.

src_text: we must put our money back into our economy by buying local products, supporting local businesses and industrie and procuring from local suppliers.
tgt_text: kumele sibuyisele imali yetfu emuva emnotfweni wetfu ngekutsenga imikhi cito yasekhaya, sisekele emabhizinisi asekhaya netimboni nekutsenga kubakhiciti basekhaya.

src_text: an injured patient with strong prospects for recovery is given regular phys ical therapy to help them get stronger until they can stand unaided.
tgt_text: sigulane lesilimele lesinematfuba lamakhulu ekululama nasiniketwa kwelashwa ngekunyakatisa mtimba kute sibe nemandla site sikhone kutimela singakasitwa.

src_text: so must these temporary relief measures be seen as the means to get our economy back on its feet.
tgt_text: kumele tibukwe njaloke letinyatselo tekusita njengetindlela tekubuyisa umnotfo wetfu esimeni sawo.

src_text: our ultimate goal is to walk again.
tgt_text: umgomo wetfu lesiwufunako kutsi sikwati kuchubeka futsi.

src_text: as a nation, let us all lend a hand.
tgt_text: njengesive, asesonkhe sifakeni sandla.

src_text: let us be part of our own development and progress.
tgt_text: asekutsi sonkhe sibe yincenye ye ntfutfuko nenchubekele mbili yetfu.

src_text: let us use the extended relief to drive a stronger recovery.
tgt_text: tinyatselo tekuvuselela umnotfo vukuzenzele unnamed sekutawuhlangana umnyaka solo kwavakala indzaba yekucala ngeligciwane lekhorona eveni letfu.

src_text: a professional public service vukuzenzele unnamed when i was elected to the position of president of south africa, i said that building an efficient, capable and ethical state free from corruption was among my foremost priorities.
tgt_text: imisebenti yahulumende lececeshekile vukuzenzele unnamed lesikhatsi ngikhetse lwa kulesikhundla sekuba ngumenga meli waseningizimu afri ka, ngatsi kwakha hulu mende losebenta kahle, lonelikhono nalonesimilo lesingenayo inkhohlaka lo bekunguletinye tintfo letimcoka lengiticalisa e mbili.

src_text: only a capable, efficient, ethical and developmentoriented state can deliver on the commitment to improve the lives of the people of this country.
tgt_text: nguhulumende lone likhono, losebenta kahle, lonesimilo nalotsembele entutfukweni kuphela longa tibophelela ekutfutfukiseni timphilo tebantfu balelive.

src_text: this means that the public service must be staffed by men and women who are professional, skilled, selfless and honest.
tgt_text: loku kusho kutsi hulume nde kufuneka abe netisebenti letibobabe nabomake labace ceshekile, labanemakhono, labatinikele nalabatsembe kile.

src_text: they must be committed to upholding the values of the constitution, and must, as i said in my inaugural speech, "faithfully serve no other cause than that of the public".
tgt_text: kufuneka batibophelele ku hambisa embili kubaluleka kwemtsetfosisekelo, futsi kufuneka kwenteke njengo ba ngishilo enkhulumeni yami yekucala, "kusebentela ummango ngekwetsembeka hhayi lenye intfo.

src_text: over the past two weeks, public consultations have been underway on an important policy document that will give greater impetus to our efforts to bolster, strengthen and capacitate the civil service.
tgt_text: "kulamaviki lamabili lengci le, kube nekucocisana ne mmango mayelana nedo khumenti yenchubomgomo lemcoka letawufaka umfu tfo lomkhulu kumitamo yetfu yekucinisa, kukhulisa nekufundzisa tisebenti tahu lumende.

src_text: the draft national implementation framework towards the professionalisation of the public service aims to build a state that better serves our people, that is insulated from undue political interference and where appointments are made on merit.
tgt_text: umtsetfosivivinyo lo luhlaka wenchubomgomo yavelonkhe lomayelana nekucecesheka kwebase benti bahulumende uhlose kwakha hulumende losebe ntela kancono bantfu bakitsi, lovikelekile ekungenelelweni kwetepolitiki lokungenasi dzingo nalocasha ngekubuka kufaneleka.

src_text: the framework was approved by cabinet in november last year and structured consultation with various sectors of society are now underway.
tgt_text: loluhlaka lwavunywa yi khabhinethi ngalweti lo mnyaka lowengcile kantsi nyalo kucocisana lokuhlele kile nemikhakha lehluka hlukene yemmango kuya chubeka.

src_text: twentyseven years into democracy, it can be said of the public service that while several pockets of excellence exist, we have serious challenges in many government departments with regards to skills, competence and professionalism.
tgt_text: eminyakeni lemashumi amabili nesikhombisa singe ne kuntsandvoyelinyenti, kungashiwo kutisebenti tahulumende kutsi nanoma kunetintfo letinengi letentiwe kahle kakhulu, sinetinseyeya letimcoka kumatiko lama nengi ahulumende letima yelana nemakhono, kwati umsebenti nekucecesheka.

src_text: all too often, people have been hired into and promoted to key positions for which they are neither suitable nor qualified.
tgt_text: esikhatsini lesinengi, bantfu bacashelwa noma bakhushulelwa etikhundleni letimcoka letingakabafaneli noma lebangakatifundzeli.

src_text: this affects government performance, but also contributes to nepotism, political interference in the work of departments, lack of accountability, mismanagement and corruption.
tgt_text: loku kunemtselela ekuse benteni kwahulumende, futsi kuphindze kungente ekucasheni ngebuhlobo, ekungeneleleni kwetepoli tiki emsebentini wematiko, kungabi nekuphendvula, kungalawuli kahle nenkho hlakalo.

src_text: there is also the related problem of political and executive interference in the administration of the public service.
tgt_text: kukhona futsi inkinga lemayelana nekungenelela kwetepolitiki nekwebapha tsi labakhulu ekwenteni imisebenti yahulumende.

src_text: one need only to look at the instability in government departments when senior managers are swopped or replaced each time a new minister is appointed.
tgt_text: umuntfu kufuneka abuke kuphela kungasimami kwematiko ahulumende uma kuntjintjiselwana noma kuntjintjwa baphatsi laba khulu njalo uma kubekwa indvuna lensha.

src_text: directorsgeneral (dgs) and provincial heads of departments (hods) are particularly affected.
tgt_text: bacondzisijikelele ne tinhloko tematiko etifundza bayatsintseka kakhulu.

src_text: in some departments, dgs, hods and executive managers have had stability of tenure, enabling the departments to function with little disruption.
tgt_text: kulamanye ematiko, emadg nabohod nebaphatsi labasetulu babe nekunga hlaliseki emsebentini laba wentako, lokwente ematiko asebente ngekuphatamiseka lokuncane.

src_text: in most of these departments where there is leadership stability, audit outcomes tend to be positive and public funds can be accounted for.
tgt_text: linyenti lalawa matiko lanebaphatsi labasi meme, imiphumela yeluhlo lomabhuku ivamise kuba mihle futsi kuba nekuphe ndvula ngekusetjentiswa kwetimali tahulumende.

src_text: where there is a high turnover of heads of department, there is often administrative turmoil.
tgt_text: lapho kuba nekuntjintja kakhulu kwebaphatsi bema tiko, kuvamise kutsi kuhlale kunekudideka.

src_text: one of the key recommendations made in the draft framework is that the public service must be depoliticised and that government departments must be insulated from politics.
tgt_text: lokunye lokumcoka kwale tincomo letentiwe kulomtse tfosivivinya loluhlaka kutsi kusebenta kwahulumende kufuneka kungangenwa tepolitiki nekutsi ematiko ahulumende kufuneka avi keleke kupolitiki.

src_text: professionalisation is necessary for stability in the public service, especially in the senior ranks.
tgt_text: kucecesheka kuyadzinge ka kute kube nekusimama kuhulumende, kakhulu etikhundleni letisetulu.

src_text: public servants must be able to continue doing their jobs "regardless of any changes of ministers, members of the executive council or councillors within the governing party in charge of the administration, or changes to political parties after elections".
tgt_text: tise benti tahulumende kufuneka tikhone kuchubeka tente umsebenti wato "nanoma ngabe kube nekuntjintjwa kwetindvuna, kwemalunga emkhandlu lophetse noma kwemakhansela ngekhatsi kwelicembu leliphetse umbu so, noma kwetingucuko temacembu etepolitiki emva kwelukhetfo".

src_text: we are proposing a number of farreaching reforms, such as extending the tenure of hods based on merit and performance, doing occupationbased competency assessments and involving the public service commission in the interviews of dgs and deputy dgs.
tgt_text: sihlongota kutsi kube ne tingucuko letinengi letibanti, letifana nekungeta sikhatsi sekusebenta kwetinhloko tematiko sihambisane neku faneleka nekusebenta kwato, kwentiwe luhlolo lolugcile ekwatini kwenta umsebenti futsi lolufaka ikhomishana yetisebenti tahulumende uma kwentiwa tingcoco tetinhlolokhono kwebaco ndzisijikelele nekwemase kela ebacondzisijikelele.

src_text: introducing integrity tests for all shortlisted individuals will help so that we can recruit civil servants who can serve honestly.
tgt_text: kucala kusebentisa luhlolo lwebucotfo kubo bonkhe bantfu labafakwe eluhlwini lwenhlololuvo kungasisita kute sikhone kucasha tise benti tahulumende letingase benta ngekwetsembeka.

src_text: we also need to extend the compulsory entrance exams that we introduced in april 2020 beyond senior management.
tgt_text: futsi kufuneka silule lokubhala kweluhlolo lwekungena loluphocelekile lesiletfule ngamabasa 2020 lwentiwe nakutikhundla letingetulu kwetebaphatsi betikhundla letisetulu.

src_text: successful developmental states have similar measures which help advance professionalism within the public service.
tgt_text: bohulumende labasatfutfuka labanemphu melelo basebentisa letindlela letifana naleti kusita kwenta kube nekucecesheka kuhulu mende.

src_text: as we note in the draft framework, "the bureaucracy must continue to loyally and diligently implement the political mandate set by voters and the party, but to refrain from being political actors themselves.
tgt_text: njengoba sibekile kulo mtsetfosivivinya loluhlaka, "inchubokuphatsa kufuneka ichubeke kulandzela ligunya letepolitiki lelibekwe bavoti kanye nelicembu letepolitiki, kodvwa bayekele kutsi bona babe yincenye yetepoliti.

src_text: "we are suggesting a more rigorous approach towards recruitment and selection of public servants, induction and performance management.
tgt_text: "sihlongota kutsi kube nendlela lenemandla yeku casha neyekukhetsa tisebenti tahulumende, yekungeniswa kwato neyekulawula umse benti wato.

src_text: this includes continuous learning and a clear professional development path for every public servant.
tgt_text: loku kufaka kuchubeka nekufundza kanye nendlela lecacile yekuceceshwa kuso sonkhe sisebenti sahulumende.

src_text: the draft framework puts emphasis on the need to hold public servants accountable for irregularities, to do away with a culture of impunity in the mismanagement and misappropriation of state resources.
tgt_text: lomtsetfosivivinya lo luhlaka ugcizelela lesidzingo sekutfwesa tisebenti licala ngekwephula umtsetfo, ku cedza lomkhuba wekungaje ziswa uma kungakaphatfwa kahle noma kabi tinsita tahulumende.

src_text: professionalising the public service involves training for accounting officers across all spheres of government on the applicable legislative provisions.
tgt_text: kucecesheka kwetisebenti tahulumende kufaka kucece shwa kwetisebenti letiphetse kuyo yonkhe imikhakha yahulumende mayelana ngaletibonelelo temtsetfo letisebentako.

src_text: the national school of government (nsg) has a vital role to play in this regard.
tgt_text: sikole savelonkhe sahu lumende sinemsebenti lo mcoka lesingawenta nga loku.

src_text: professionalism is not only about having the right qualifications and technical skills, but also about having appropriate standards of respect, courtesy and integrity in dealing with members of the public.
tgt_text: kucecesheka emsebentini akusiko kuphela kuba ne ticu letifanele nemakhono ekwenta msebenti, kodvwa kumayelana nekuba nema zinga lafanele enhlonipho, kunakekela nekubacotfo uma usebenta nemalunga emmango.

src_text: the public service is diverse, with a huge range of skills, qualifications and capabilities.
tgt_text: umsebenti wahulumende wehlukahlukene, unemakho no lamakhulu lahlukahluke ne, ticu nelwati lwemsebenti.

src_text: many public servants have specialised skills that are necessary for the effective provision of services.
tgt_text: tisebenti tahulumende leti nengi tinemakhono elukhe tselo ladzingekako ekwente ni kahle umsebenti.

src_text: it is therefore not necessarily the case that we need a smaller public service: what we actually need is a fitforpurpose public service with suitable skills, a professional ethic and a commitment to serving the people.
tgt_text: ngakoke akusilo liciniso kutsi sidzinga linani lelincane letisebenti ta hulumende: lesikudzingako tisebenti letikwati kwenta umsebenti letinemakhono lafanele, letinesimilo sekuce cesheka naletinekutibophe lela ekusebenteleni bantfu.

src_text: the men and women of the public service need to be capacitated to play their role in driving development and consolidating democracy.
tgt_text: bobabe nabomake labase benta kuhulumende kufu neka baniketwe emandla ekwenta umsebenti wabo we kuchubekisa intfutfuko ne wekuhlanganisa intsandvo yelinyenti.

src_text: this is our best guarantee of a capable state that serves the interests of citizens.
tgt_text: loku kusici nisekiso setfu lesikhulu sahulumende lonelikhono lolandzela tifiso tetakhamuti.

src_text: i call on you to be part of the public consultation process around this draft framework, which is available on the nsg's website, and to make your voice heard.
tgt_text: ngiyanicela nonkhe kutsi nibe yincenye yalenchubo yekucocisana nemmango mayelana nalomtsetfosivi vinya loluhlaka, lotfolakala kuwebhusayithi yesikolo savelonkhe sahulumende, nekutsi nente luvo lwenu luvakale.

src_text: the public service does not belong to any one party, nor should it be the domain of any particular interest group.
tgt_text: hulumende akasiyo ince nye yanoma nguliphi licembu letepolitiki, futsi akufuneki abe sizindza sanoma ngu liphi licembu alitsandzako.

src_text: it should not be a law unto itself.
tgt_text: akufuneki atishayele wakhe umtsetfo.

src_text: the public service belongs to the people of south africa.
tgt_text: hulumende wabo bonkhe bantfu baseningizimu afrika.

src_text: it must serve them and them alone.
tgt_text: imisebenti yahulumende lececeshekile vukuzenzele unnamed lesikhatsi ngikhetse lwa kulesikhundla sekuba ngumenga meli waseningizimu afri ka, ngatsi kwakha hulu mende losebenta kahle, lonelikhono nalonesimilo lesingenayo inkhohlaka lo bekunguletinye tintfo letimcoka lengiticalisa e mbili.

src_text: traditional leaders key to recovery efforts vukuzenzele unnamed in the last few months, we have had to bid a sad farewell to two of our country’s most respected traditional monarchs.
tgt_text: baholi bendzabuko bamcoka emitameni yetfu yekululama vukuzenzele unnamed kuletinyanga leti mbalwa letengcile, kudzingeke ku tsi sivalelise kabuhlungu emakhosi endzabuko lama bili lahlonipheke kakhu lu eveni letfu.

src_text: the zulu people recently laid to rest his majesty king goodwill zwelithini ka bhekuzulu who reigned for half a century.
tgt_text: sive semazulu sisandza kufihla lohloniphekile ka khulu inkhosi goodwill zwelithini ka bhekuzulu lobuse sigamu seminyaka lelikhulu.

src_text: in january, the bapedi people buried kgoshikgolo thulare thulare iii, who passed away less than a year after his inauguration.
tgt_text: ngabhimbidvwa ne, sive semapedi sifihle kgoshikgolo thulare thulare iii, lokhotseme anesikhatsi lesingaphansi kwemnyaka abekwe esihlalweni.

src_text: with their passing, we have lost champions of the preservation of our heritage, and revered custodians of the histories of their respective peoples.
tgt_text: ngekushona kwabo, si lahlekelwe bantfu labahamba embili ekulondvoloteni tintfo letimagugu etfu, nebantfu la bahlonishwako labanakekela bavikele imilandvo yebantfu babo labahlukahlukene.

src_text: at the same time, they were vital players in rural development, and were committed to driving programmes to uplift the material conditions of their people.
tgt_text: ngalokufanako futsi, beba bantfu labamcoka labatfutfu kisa tindzawo tasemakhaya, futsi batibophelele ekuchu bekiseni embili tinhlelo teku tfutfukisa timo letibona kalako tebantfu babo.

src_text: with the advent of democracy in 1994, it was a priority of the new government to restore the integrity and legitimacy of traditional leadership in line with indigenous law and customs and subject to the constitution of the republic.
tgt_text: ngekungena kwentsandvo yelinyenti ngemnyaka we1994, kwaba yintfo lecaliswa embili nguhulumende lo musha kubuyisela sitfunti nekwenta buholi bendzabuko bube semtsetfweni buhambi sane nemitsetfo yendzabuko nemihambo yayo futsi bu landzela umtsetfosisekelo weriphabhulikhi.

src_text: the institution of traditional leadership continues to play an important role in the lives of millions of people around our country, especially in rural areas.
tgt_text: sikhungo sebuholi bendza buko sisachubeka kudlala inzi ma lemcoka etimphilweni tetinkhulungwane tebantfu balo lonkhe live letfu, kakhu lu etindzaweni tasemapha ndleni.

src_text: traditional leaders support and drive development in their communities.
tgt_text: baholi bendzabuko basekela baphindze bachu bekisele embili intfutfuko emimangweni yabo.

src_text: recently, i had the opportunity to participate in the debate on the opening of the national house of traditional leaders, which was concerned with the most pressing issues currently facing the country.
tgt_text: muva nje, ngibe nelitfuba lekuba yincenye yenkhulu momphikiswano yekuvulwa kwendlu yavelonkhe yeba holi bendzabuko, lebeyikha tsetekile ngetintfo tanyalo le tihamba embili letikhungetse live letfu.

src_text: what was particularly refreshing about the robust engagement was that traditional leadership has a keen appreciation of the difficult economic conditions facing our country, and want to be part of addressing the many challenges of underdevelopment and poverty in their areas.
tgt_text: intfo beyigcugcutela kakhu lu mayelana nalokucocisana lokunemandla bekungukutsi buholi bendzabuko buyasivi sisa kakhulu lesimo lesimati ma setemnotfo lesikhungetse live letfu, futsi bufuna kuba yincenye yekusombulula le tinsayeya letinyenti tekunga tfutfuki ngalokufanele nete buphuya etindzaweni tabo.

src_text: i have consistently said that our economic recovery in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic must be inclusive, and that nobody must be left behind.
tgt_text: bengihlala ngisho kutsi kuiulama kwemnotfo wetfu emuva kwalobhubhane weligciwane lekhorona kufuneka kufake wonkhe umuntfu, futsi kute umuntfu lekufuneka ashiywe emuva.

src_text: the success of the economic reconstruction and recovery plan rests on forging strong partnerships between not just government, business and labour, but also with traditional leadership and other societal formations.
tgt_text: imphumelelo yeluhlelo lwekululama nelekwakha kabusha umnotfo igcile ekwakheni kusebentisana lokunemandla hhayi ku phela emkhatsini kwahu lumende, kwabosoma bhizinisi netisebenti, kodvwa nasemkhatsini kwebuholi bendzabuko kanye nase mkhatsini kwaletinye takhi wo temmango.

src_text: a constant refrain from participants in the debate recently was that they do not want to be dependent on handouts or for their communities to perpetually look to government for financial assistance.
tgt_text: intfo beyiloku ivela ku babambi lichaza ngalokuco cisana kwamuva nje beku kutsi abafuni kuhlala bacela noma kutsi imimango yabo ihlale ibuke hulumende kutsi ayisite ngetetimali.

src_text: they want to be provided with the necessary support, training and enabling environment to allow rural communities to be selfsufficient.
tgt_text: bafuna kunikwa kwese kelwa lokudzingekako, kuceceshwa kanye nesimo lesenta tintfo tenteke kute kuvunyelwe imimango ya semaphandleni kutsi ikhone kutimela itentele tintfo.

src_text: they want to bridge the urbanrural divide in access to government services and private sector resources.
tgt_text: bafuna kucedza lomehluko lokhona etindzaweni tase madolobheni netasemapha ndleni wekufinyelela kuti nsita tahulumende nakuti nsita temkhakha wangasese.

src_text: what they would like to see is for rural areas to become centres of economic activity, industry and employment opportunity.
tgt_text: lebafisa kukubona kutsi tindzawo tasemaphandleni tibe tikhungo temisebenti yetemnotfo, yetimboni neye tematfuba emisebenti.

src_text: this mirrors the aspirations of the district development model (ddm), which was launched in 2019. traditional leaders are well positioned to ensure that district plans are informed by and respond to the real needs of communities and that they reflect the lived reality in rural areas.
tgt_text: loku kuyafana netifiso temo deli yekutfutfukisa tigodzi (iddm), leyasungulwa ngemnyaka we2019.

src_text: just as the ddm supports localised programmes that focus on the needs, strengths and opportunities in specific areas, traditional leaders have pioneered their own approach to local economic development.
tgt_text: baholi bendzabuko base ndzaweni lekahle yekucini sekisa kutsi tinhlelo tesigodzi tiyatiwa futsi tiphindze tiphe ndvule kutidzingo temma ngo tangemphela nekutsi tikhomba imphilo yange mphela lephilwa etindza weni tasemaphandleni.

src_text: they have developed the investrural masterplan, which was launched in north west last month.
tgt_text: njengoba iddm isekela tinhlelo tendzawo letigcile kutidzingo, emandleni nekumatfuba etindzaweni letitsite, baholi bendzabuko basungule yabo indlela yekutfutfukisa umnotfo wendzawo.

src_text: it is greatly encouraging that traditional leaders have rallied behind the plan and want to work with local authorities to ensure it is a success.
tgt_text: basungule luhlelo lolu khulu lwekusisa etindza weni tasemaphandleni (iinvestrural masterplan), lelatfulwa enyakatfo nshona langa kulenyanga leyengcile.

src_text: during the debate in the national house of traditional leaders it was proposed that a major success factor for the investrural programme is that traditional structures are trained, strengthened and capacitated.
tgt_text: kuyasigcugcutela kakhulu kutsi baholi bendzabuko bayalusekela loluhlelo futsi bafuna kusebentisana neba phatsi bendzawo kucinise kisa kutsi luyaphumelela.

src_text: a number of participants outlined economic plans that are already in advanced stages of development.
tgt_text: ngalesikhatsi kubanjwe inkhulumomphikiswano endlini yavelonkhe yebaholi bendzabuko kwahlongotwa kutsi intfo lenkhulu lenga ngeta imphumelelo ye luhlelo lolukhulu lweku sisa etindzaweni tasemapha ndleni ngikutsi kuceceshwe emacembu emmango endza buko, akhuliswe futsi anikwe emakhono.

src_text: these range from agricultural projects to bioprospecting to renewable energy.
tgt_text: babambi lichaza labanengi bachaza tinhlelo tetemnotfo lesevele tisezingeni lelisetulu lekutfutfuka.

src_text: what was evident is that the institution of traditional leadership understands that professionalisation is necessary for rural businesses in the form of small, medium and micro enterprises and cooperatives to become part of the mainstream economy.
tgt_text: loku kufaka imiklamo yetekulima kuya kuluchwaningo lwemitsi lesuselwa etilwaneni naseti tjalweni kuyofika kumnotfo wemandla langapheli.

src_text: the traditional leaders who spoke presented their vision of ‘developmental monarchs’, who see themselves as not just custodians of heritage but also as drivers of economic prosperity and progress.
tgt_text: lobekubonakala kutsi lesi khungo sebuholi bendzabuko siyavisisa kutsi kwenta tintfo ngebuchwephesha kumcoka emabhizinisini asemapha ndleni lafana nemabhizinisi lamancane, lasemkhatsini nalasafufusa nalanjengema khophorethivu kute abe yi ncenye yemnotfo lomkhulu.

src_text: they have identified several projects and economic opportunities that will create jobs and improve livelihoods in rural areas.
tgt_text: baholi bendzabuko lebe bakhuluma batfula imibo nonchanti yabo ‘yebukhosi lobusatfutfuka’, lobutibona hhayi kuphela njengebantfu labahlonishwako labanake kela emagugu kodvwa futsi njengebantfu labachubekisa embili kukhula kwetemnotfo netenchubekela embili.

src_text: traditional leaders have also expressed their willingness to play an active part in the land reform process.
tgt_text: babo ne imiklamo lehlukahlukene nematfuba etemnotfo la tawuvula ematfuba emise benti futsi atfutfukise tindlela tekutiphilisa etindzaweni tasemakhaya.

src_text: since 2018, traditional leaders have made around 1 500 000 hectares of communal land available for development, and it is hoped this will increase in future.
tgt_text: baholi bendzabuko baphi ndze bavakalisa sifiso sabo sekuba yincenye lenkhulu yalenchubo yetingucuko temhlaba.

src_text: to develop a coordinated and sustainable strategy, we have agreed to hold a presidential land summit in the next year.
tgt_text: kusuka ngemnya ka we2018, baholi bendza buko babeke eceleni umhlaba longatfolakala locishe ube mahektha la1 500 000 we kuhlalisa bantfu longatfu tfukiswa, futsi kunelitsemba lekutsi lelinani litawukhula esikhatsini lesitako.

src_text: this will discuss pressing issues around land reform and its impact on communal land, much of which is located in rural areas.
tgt_text: kute sisungule indlela lisu lehlelekile nalesimeme, sivumelene kutsi sibambe ingcungcutsela yelitsimba lamengameli letemhlaba ku lomnyaka lotako.

src_text: the tone of the debate in the national house was a fitting reflection of a climate in which economic recovery is foremost among our considerations.
tgt_text: kule ngcu ngcutsela kutawucocisana ngetintfo letimcoka letimaye lana netingucuko temhlaba nemitselela yato kutemihlaba yekuhlalisa ummango, leli nyenti lawo lisetindzaweni tasemaphandleni.

src_text: at the same time it was a promising signal that traditional leaders appreciate their role in being part of the national recovery effort through being proactive and innovative.
tgt_text: lomoya walenkhulumo mphikiswano lebeyibanjwe endlini yavelonkhe bewu dzingakala kute kubukwe simo lapho khona kulu lama kwemnotfo kucaliswa embili kunaletinye tintfo.

src_text: the most fitting legacy of great leaders is that the seeds of development they sow during their tenure grow into mighty trees that protect and shelter their communities for posterity.
tgt_text: ngaso leso sikhatsi kube nenkhomba leletsa litsemba lekutsi baholi bendzabuko bayawutfokotela umsebenti wabo wekuba yincenye yemitamo yavelonkhe ye kululama ngekwenta tintfo tenteke futsi nangemicondvo yabo lemisha.

src_text: as we work together as a country to rebuild our economy, we will continue to count on the support of the institution of traditional leadership, which is an inextricable part of our past, our present and our future.
tgt_text: baholi bendzabuko bamcoka emitameni yetfu yekululama vukuzenzele unnamed kuletinyanga leti mbalwa letengcile, kudzingeke ku tsi sivalelise kabuhlungu emakhosi endzabuko lama bili lahlonipheke kakhu lu eveni letfu.

src_text: religious community vital in the fight against covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed recently many south africans of faith have joined others across the world in important religious observances.
tgt_text: ummango wetenkholo ubaluleke kakhulu ekulweni necovid19 vukuzenzele unnamed bantfu labanyenti baseningizimu afrika betenkholo bahlanganyele nalabanye emhlabeni wonkhe jike lele ekugubheni umkho si wetenkholo.

src_text: members of the jewish faith celebrated pesach, chris tians observed easter and muslims will soon be observing the holy month of ramadan.
tgt_text: emalunga etenkholo yemajuta agu bhe umkhosi wepesach , emakholwa etenkho lo yebukhristu agubhe umkhosi weliphasika futsi emasulumane wona masi nyanenje atawube agubha inyanga lengcwele yeramadan .

src_text: for the second year, these occasions have been marked in the midst of a devastating global pandemic that has cost the lives of more than 2.5 million people across the world.
tgt_text: ngumnyaka we sibili manje, lemikhosi lena igujwa ngesikhatsi selubhubhane lwemave emhlaba lolwephulana umoya lolutsetse timphilo tebantfu la bangetulu kwetigidzi leti2.5 emhlabeni wonkhe jikelele.

src_text: faithbased organisations have been vital to our national response to the disease, not only providing spiritual comfort and guidance, but also by caring for those most vulnerable to the effects of the pandemic, including through the provision of food, shelter and other social services.
tgt_text: tinhlangano tetenkholo tibe nguletibalulekile eku bukaneni kwetfu nalesifo, betinganiketinje kuphela kudvudvuteka kwemphe fumulo, kepha betiphindze futsi tinakekele labo la bahlaseleke kalula ludvosi lwalolubhubhane, kufaka ekhatsi kubanika kudla, indzawo yekukhosela kanye naletinye tinsita tetenhlalo.

src_text: religion plays an important role in the lives of millions of south africans, and congregational worship forms a vital part of their religious practice.
tgt_text: tenkholo tidlala indzi ma lebaluleke kakhulu etimphilweni tetigidzi tebantfu baseningizimu afrika, futsi kudvumisa bandzawonye kwabo kuyincenye lebaluleke kakhulu ekukhonteni kwabo.

src_text: being able to gather for religious services is also a welcome respite from a period of great hardship for individuals, families and communities.
tgt_text: kukhona kuhlangana ndza wonye ngekwetinsita te tenkholo kukuhhamuleka lokwemukelekile ngemuva kwesikhatsi lesimatima kakhulu kubantfu labehlukene, kumindeni kanye nemimango.

src_text: it is understandable that after more than a year of labouring under restrictions on religious gatherings that the faith community are keen for a return to a semblance of normality.
tgt_text: kuyavisiseka kutsi ngemu va kwesikhatsi lesingetulu kwemnyaka sekusebenta ngaphasi kwetimo letibeka imikhawulo kumibutsano ye tenkholo kutsi ummango we tenkholo unenshisekelo yeku buyela esimeni lesetayelekile.

src_text: in recognition of the importance of congregational worship to the lives of our people, government has been engaging with the faith community.
tgt_text: ekucabangeleni kubalu leka kwekukhontela ndza wonye etimphilweni te bantfu bakitsi, hulumende abeloku akhulumisana nemmango wetenkholo.

src_text: leaders of the faith community understand and appreciate the very real danger of a new wave of covid19 infections.
tgt_text: baholi bemmango wetenkholo bayavisisa futsi bayayibona ingoti yekucubuka lokusha kwecovid19 .

src_text: since the outbreak of the pandemic, religious organisations have taken proactive and positive measures to limit the spread of the disease among worshippers.
tgt_text: kusukela kwabhedvuka lo lubhubhane, tinhlangano tetenkholo titsetse tinyatselo tekuvimbela naletikahle te kunciphisa kubhebhetseka kwalesifo emakholweni.

src_text: another important factor is that during the various alert levels, religious organisations have incurred substantial financial losses that threaten their sustainability.
tgt_text: lokunye lokubalulekile kutsi ngalesikhatsi setigaba teku caphelisa, tinhlangano tetenkholo tihlangabetane neku lahlekelwa timali lokukhulu lokube yinkinga ekusimame ni kwato.

src_text: as government we remain committed to working with the faith community to find workable solutions.
tgt_text: singuhulumende siyachubeka nekutinikela ekusebentisaneni nemmango wetenkholo kute kutsi sitfole sisombululo lesikahle.

src_text: at the same time, public health and safety must be our paramount consideration.
tgt_text: ngaso sona leso sikhatsi, temphilo nekuphepha kwesive kufanele kutsi kube yintfo lesicaba nga ngayo kakhulu.

src_text: the religious community has shown innovation and initiative in the holding of worship at a time when there was a great deal of uncertainty over the trajectory of the pandemic.
tgt_text: ummango wetenkholo ukhombise kukhona kwenta imitamo nekwenta tintfo ngendlela lensha mayelana nekuchuba tinkonzo ngesikhatsi lapho khona bekunekungaciniseki lokukhulu mayelana nekutsi lo lubhubhane lucondze kuphi.

src_text: congregational services were held online and worshippers were encouraged to pray in their homes instead of attending services.
tgt_text: tinkonzo tekuhlangana ndzawonye betentiwa ngeinthanethi futsi emakholwa bekakhutsatwa kutsi athantaze etindlini tawo esikhundleni sekutsi aye enkonzweni etakhiweni.

src_text: this greatly aided the national effort to contain the spread of the disease.
tgt_text: loku kuyisite kakhulu imi tamo yavelonkhe yekulawu la kubhebhetseka kwalesifo.

src_text: religious leaders played a pivotal role in encouraging public adherence to health measures around important customary and cultural rituals like burials.
tgt_text: baholi betenkholo badlale indzima lebaluleke ka khulu ekukhutsateni sive kutsi silandzele tinyatselo tetemphilo mayelana ne tinchubo temihambo ne masiko njengemingcwabo.

src_text: by equal measure, our people have demonstrated their commitment to adhering to public health protocols and to social distancing.
tgt_text: ngalokulinganako, bantfu bakitsi bakhombise kuti nikela kwabo ekugcineni tindlelanchubo tetemphilo kanye nekukhweshelana.

src_text: and they correctly appreciate that they must continue to avoid large gatherings .
tgt_text: futsi bayakutfokotela kutsi bafanele kutsi bachubeke nekugwema imi butsano lemikhulu.

src_text: we are now at a time where precaution is needed above all.
tgt_text: manje sisesikhatsini lapho khona kucilika kudzingeka ngetulu kwako konkhe.

src_text: the coronavirus pandemic has not been eliminated, either in our own country or around the world.
tgt_text: lolubhubhane lweligci wane lekhorona alikapheli, lapha eveni letfu noma emhlabeni wonkhe jikelele.

src_text: the threat of a third wave is real and everpresent.
tgt_text: kwesatjiswa kwekucubuka kwesitsatfu kukhona sibili futsi kutawuhlala kukhona.

src_text: international experience has taught us that we should not tempt fate.
tgt_text: lesikubonile emaveni emhlaba kusifundzise kutsi singatenti tintfo letingema gangangoti.

src_text: many countries have eased restrictions, only for there to be resurgences, necessitating the imposition of even harsher restrictions.
tgt_text: emave lamanyenti acekise imikhawulo, kodvwa kwatfolakala kutsi siyacubuka futsi lesifo, lokoke kwabese kudzinga kutsi kuhlisibetwe le minye imikhawulo leseyitse kuba matima kakhulu.

src_text: large gatherings, whether religious or otherwise, have the potential to spread the virus, despite the application of measures around social distancing and sanitising.
tgt_text: imibutsano lemikhulu, kungaba yetenkholo noma yalokunye, inemandla ekubhebhetsekisa leligci wane, ngisho noma ngabe kulandzelwa tinchubo tekuphepha tekukhweshelana nekugeza tandla ngesibulalamagciwane.

src_text: millions of south africans have been observing an important tenet of their faith.
tgt_text: bantfu labanyenti baseningizimu afrika bebaloku bagcina inkholo yabo lebalu lekile.

src_text: in a country that enshrines the right to religious freedom, all effort must be made to support our people in the exercise of this right.
tgt_text: eveni leligcina lilunge lo lenkhululeko yetenkholo, kufanele kutsi kwentiwe yonkhe imitamo lengentiwa kwesekelwe bantfu bakitsi ekusebentiseni lelilungelo.

src_text: and in exercising this right, we need to make sure that we do not place the rights or the lives of others at risk.
tgt_text: futsike ekusebentiseni leli lungelo, sifanele kutsi sente siciniseko sekutsi asifaki le lilungelo nomake timphilo talabanye bantfu engotini.

src_text: this is a principle that the religious leaders i met with fully support and appreciate.
tgt_text: lona ngumtsetfomgomo ebaholi betenkholo lengihlangene nabo labawe sekela futsi bawujabulele ngalokuphelele.

src_text: they understand the responsibility of all people of faith – indeed of all south africans – to observe the practical measures put in place to protect people’s health and save lives.
tgt_text: bayasivisisa sibopho sabo bonkhe bantfu betenkholo – ngempela sabo bonkhe bantfu baseningi zimu afrika – kutsi bagcine tinyatselo letimisiwe teku vikela tetemphilo yebantfu nekusindzisa timphilo.

src_text: for more than a year, we have worked together as a society to contain this pandemic.
tgt_text: sesikhatsi lesingetulu kwemnyaka, sisebentisa na singummango silawu la lolubhubhane.

src_text: now as we work to overcome it, we need to reaffirm our shared determination to act responsibly and cautiously.
tgt_text: manje njengaloku sisebentela kuluncoba, sifuna kucinise kisa kutinikela kwetfu kutiphatsa ngalokunesibopho nekwenta tintfo ngekucilika.

src_text: in doing so, we will be giving practical effect to the universal messages of hope, salvation, freedom and solidarity that will be spoken of in the churches, synagogues, mosques and homes of our land in the days and weeks ahead.
tgt_text: ummango wetenkholo ubaluleke kakhulu ekulweni necovid19 vukuzenzele unnamed bantfu labanyenti baseningizimu afrika betenkholo bahlanganyele nalabanye emhlabeni wonkhe jike lele ekugubheni umkho si wetenkholo.

src_text: port of durban creates a sea of opportunities for sa vukuzenzele unnamed recently, i visit ed the port of durban to see for myself the work being done to make the port more efficient and competitive.
tgt_text: sikhumulo semikhumbi sasethekwini sakhela iningizimu afrika ematfuba labanti vukuzenzele unnamed kamuva, ngivakashele sikhumulo semi khumbi sasethe kwini kuyotibonela umse benti lowentiwako lowenta lesikhumulo kutsi sibe neli khono nekuchudzelana kahle.

src_text: after a briefing with the senior management of transnet, i toured the harbour in a pilot boat, which is usually used to guide large ships through the entrance channel to the pier.
tgt_text: ngemuva kwekutsi labaphe tse bakatransnet batsi kungicha tsatela, ngivakashele lendzawo yekungenisa imikhumbi ngesi kebhe lesincane, lesiyaye sise tjentiswe kuhola imikhumbi le mikhulu endzaweni lekungena khona imikhumbi.

src_text: seeing the workings of the port from the water, one is reminded of its vast scale and complexity.
tgt_text: kubona kusebenta kwale sikhumulo usema ntini, umuntfu ukhunju twa bukhulu bendzawo nebuma tima bekusebenta kwaso.

src_text: if the port does not function efficiently, the entire economy suffers, from importers and exporters to consumers.
tgt_text: uma lesikhumulo singase benti kahle, umnotfo wonkhe uyahlukumeteka, kusukela ku labangenisa lokutsengwa nga phandle nalabatfumela nga phandle kuya kubatsengi.

src_text: on the other hand, if the port works well it can drive economic growth and position our country as a gateway to the region and the continent.
tgt_text: kulolunye luhlangotsi, uma lesikhumulo sisebenta kahle, singafukula kukhula kwemnotfo futsi sibeke live letfu njengelisa ngo leledlulela kusigodzi kanye nakulelivekati.

src_text: when i visited durban in october 2019, many local businesses and port users raised concerns with me about the performance of the durban port.
tgt_text: ngalesikhatsi ngivakashele ethekwini ngemphala 2019, emabhizinisi lamanyenti endzawo nalabasebentisa sikhu mulo baphakamisa tikhalo nge kusebenta kwesikhumulo sasethekwini.

src_text: shipping companies, in particular, expressed concern about truck congestion and waiting times, ship berthing delays and anchorage times, poor maintenance of equipment and generally low productivity in the port.
tgt_text: tinkampani letitfutsa timpha hla, ikakhulukati, tavakalisa kungeneliseki ngesiminyemi nye semaloli netikhatsi te kulindza, kwephuta kubeka indzawo yemikhumbi neti khatsi tekuyimisa, kunganake kelwa kahle kwetisetjentiswa kanye nekukhicita lokuphasi ngalokwetayelekile kwalesi khumulo.

src_text: my recent visit to the port was to check whether the commitments made in response to these concerns had been implemented.
tgt_text: kuvakasha kwami kwakamu va kulesikhumulo bekukutsi ngitohlola kutsi ngabe kutibo phelela lokwentiwe ngemuva kwetikhalo sekwentekile.

src_text: there has indeed been great progress over the past year in turning around the performance of the port, despite the impact of covid19.
tgt_text: impela, kube nenchubekele mbili ekuguculeni kusebenta kwalesikhumulo kulomnya ka lophelile, nanoma bekune mtselela wecovid19 .

src_text: these efforts are already showing results in improved maintenance of equipment, reduced congestion, quicker turnaround times and increased use of rail instead of road transport.
tgt_text: lemitamo seyivele ikhombisa imiphumela ekunakekelweni lokwentiwe ncono kwetisetjenti swa , kwehla kwesiminyeminye, kuphangisa kwesikhatsi sekwe nta umsebenti kanye, nekusetje ntiswa kwesitimela kunekuha mbisa ngemgwaco.

src_text: while this is important progress, there is still much work to be done to position durban as a worldclass port and as a hub port for the southern hemisphere.
tgt_text: nanoma loku kuyinchube kelembili lebalulekile, mnyenti umsebenti lokusamele wentiwe kuze sibeke itheku njengesi khumulo lesisezingeni lelisetu lu lemhlaba futsi njengesikhu mulo lesisemkhatsini sencenye yemhlaba lengaseningizimu.

src_text: in recent years, the port has slipped from its position as first in africa to third, behind tangier in morocco and port said in egypt.
tgt_text: eminyakeni lesandza kundlu la, lesikhumulo sisukile endza weni yaso njengesekucala eafrika saba sesitsatfu, sala ndzela itangier lesemorocco neport said leseegypt.

src_text: truck turnaround times have greatly improved.
tgt_text: tikhatsi tekusebenta kwema loli titfutfukile kakhulu.

src_text: similarly, the reliability of cargo handling equipment has improved to 80% and is heading towards at least 95% to meet international benchmarks.
tgt_text: ngalo kunjalo, kusebenta kahle kweti setjentiswa letilayisha imitfwalo lemikhulu kutfutfuke kwaya ku80% futsi kuyachubeka kuya lokungenani ku95% kuze kutsi kuhlangabetane netimiso temave ngemave.

src_text: ship waiting times have reduced to impressive levels.
tgt_text: tikhatsi teku lindza kwemikhumbi tinciphe ngalokunelisako.

src_text: these statistics may seem technical and obscure, but they have a direct impact on the growth of our economy and on the prices we pay as consumers.
tgt_text: letibalobalo tingabonakala kwangatsi tiyaphica futsi tisitse kile, kodvwa tinemtselelangco ekukhuleni kwemnotfo wetfu kanye nakulamanani lesiwakho khelako njengebatsengi.

src_text: we have made improving the efficiency of our ports a priority of operation vulindlela and have focused on rebuilding transnet, which is one of our valued stateowned enterprises.
tgt_text: sente kwentiwa ncono kwe kusebenta kahle kwetikhumulo tetfu kube seluhlwini lolusetulu lweoperation vulindlela futsi sigcile ekwakheni kabusha itransnet, lekungulenye yemabhizinisi embuso wetfu laligugu.

src_text: the new management of transnet and its operating divisions are resolutely focused on turning the performance of the port around.
tgt_text: baphatsi labasha betrans net netigaba tayo tekusebenta bancume kugcila ekuguculeni kusebenta kwalesikhumulo.

src_text: the management has ambitious and exciting expansion plans for all five of the port’s precincts.
tgt_text: baphatsi banenshisekelo ne tinhlelo letitsakasisako tekwa ndzisa emabala aletikhumulo letisihlanu.

src_text: these include the deepening of the maydon wharf channel to allow larger, modern vessels to enter the port, the infill of pier 1 and pier 2 to create additional capacity for con tainers and the development of a new container terminal in the point precinct.
tgt_text: loku kufaka phakatsi ku julisa umgudvu imaydon wharf kuvumela imikhumbi yesimanje kutsi ingene esi khumulweni, kugcwaliswa kwepier 1 napier 2 lokuto kwakha umtsamo longetiwe wetintfo tekuphatsa neku tfutfukiswa kwetiteshi tetintfo tekuphatsa letinsha kupoint precinct.

src_text: altogether, the expansion of infrastructure at the port will require r100 billion in new investment over the next decade and more.
tgt_text: sekuhlangene, lokwengetwa kwesakhiwonchanti kulesikhu mulo kutawudzinga tigidzigi dzi letir100 kutjalomali lolu sha esikhatsini seminyaka leli shumi nangetulu.

src_text: this will completely transform the port, expanding its capacity for container handling from 2.9 million units to more than 11 million units.
tgt_text: loku kutawuntjintja lesikhu mulo ngalokuphelele, kwe ngete nemtsamo wekubeka kwekuphatsa kusuka kumayu nithi latigidzi le2.9 kuye kula ngetulu kwalatigidzi le11 .

src_text: these ambitious plans will require greater private sector participation and investment.
tgt_text: letinhlelo letinenshisekelo titawudzinga kuhlanganyela nelutjalomali lolukhulu lwemi khakha yangasese.

src_text: transnet, including the durban port, is an important national asset belonging to the people of south africa.
tgt_text: itransnet, nesikhumulo sasethekwini lifa lesive lelibalulekile lebantfu ba seningizimu afrika.

src_text: partnerships with the private sector are crucial to bring new investment, technology and expertise to port operations and to modernise equipment and infrastructure.
tgt_text: kuhlanganyela nemikha kha yangasese kubalule ke ngalokwendlulele eku letseni lutjalomali lolusha, bucwepheshe kanye ne bungcweti emisebentini yetikhumulo nokwe nta tisetjentiswa nesakhi wonchanti sesikhatsi sa nyalo.

src_text: transnet is planning, for example, to advertise a concession later this year to build and operate the new point terminal.
tgt_text: itransnet ihlela, sibonelo, kukhangisa imvume yekwakha iphindze isebentise lepoint ter minal lensha nasekutawuphela lomnyaka.

src_text: this will bring in private investment and improve the efficiency of container handling.
tgt_text: loku kutawuletsa lutjalomali lwangasese futsi ku tfutfukiswe kuphatsa kahle kwetintfo tekuphatsa.

src_text: through our reform process we are steadily improving the efficiency of our ports and railways and unlocking massive investment in infrastructure.
tgt_text: ngetinchubo letiguculiwe tetfu siyatfutfukisa ngesineke kusebenta kahle kwetikhu mulo tetfu nemizila yetiti mela futsi sivula lutjalomali lolukhulu kusakhiwonchanti.

src_text: this will not only lower costs and improve the competitiveness of our exports, but will create thousands of new jobs in the process.
tgt_text: loku akunawehlisa kuphela tindleko nekutfutfukisa kuse benta ngelikhono kweku tfumela ngaphandle imikhicito, kodvwa kutowakha tinkhu lungwane temisebenti lemisha nasichubeka.

src_text: through both operational improvements and structural reforms, durban port will reclaim its place as the bestperforming port in africa.
tgt_text: ngekwentiwa ncono kwako kokubili kusebente netingu cuko tesakhiwo, sikhumulo sasethekwini sitawubuyela endzaweni yaso yekuba sikhu mulo lesisebenta kahle kakhulu eafrika.

src_text: as part of our reconstruction and recove ry plan, we will continue to work tirelessly to expand infrastructure investment and transform our network industries.
tgt_text: njengencenye yetfu yeluhlelo lwekwakha kabusha nekuvu setelwa kwemnotfo sitawuchu beka nekusebenta ngekutikha ndla kwandzisa lutjalomali lwesakhiwonchanti nekugucula timboni lesitfungene nato.

src_text: if my visit to durban left one thing in my mind, it is that we south africans are capable of succeeding in projects of vast importance and scale.
tgt_text: uma ngabe kuvakashela kwami ethekwini kushiye intfo yinye engcondvweni yami, ku tsi tsine bantfu baseningizimu afrika siyakhona kuphumelela emisebentini lebaluleke kakhu lu nalemikhulu kakhulu.

src_text: our ambitions should match the size of our challenges.
tgt_text: inshisekelo yetfu kufanele ilingane nebukhulu betinca bhayi tetfu.

src_text: with the progress we are making at the durban port, with the reinvigorated skills and capabilities that we have in transnet, we now have the wind in our sails.
tgt_text: ngalenchubekelembili lesiye nta esikhumulweni sasethekwi ni, nemakhono nebungcweti lo buvuselelwe lesinabo etrans net, sesinemdlandla nyalo.

src_text: and we are moving at a rate of knots towards our destination.
tgt_text: sikhumulo semikhumbi sasethekwini sakhela iningizimu afrika ematfuba labanti vukuzenzele unnamed kamuva, ngivakashele sikhumulo semi khumbi sasethe kwini kuyotibonela umse benti lowentiwako lowenta lesikhumulo kutsi sibe neli khono nekuchudzelana kahle.

src_text: robust media more critical than ever vukuzenzele unnamed we live in a country where not just journalists but any member of the public is able to freely articulate their views, their opinions and indeed their dissatisfaction without fear of retribution.
tgt_text: betindzaba labaci nilebamcoka kakhulu kunakucala vukuzenzele unnamed siphila eveni lapho hhayi tintsatseli kuphela ko dvwa nome ngabe nguliphi lilunga lemmango liyakhona kuvakalisa luvo lwalo, imibono yawo futsi kanye nekungenetiseki kwawo ngaphandle kwekwesaba kujeziswa.

src_text: we have come a long way from the days where social protest by artists attracted banning orders, and critical reporting by journalists risked imprisonment or the closure of publications.
tgt_text: sibuya khasane emala ngeni lapho kubhikisha ngekwenhlalo kwemaciko kwakubangela kutsi kube nemiyalo yekuvalwa u mlomo, kanye nekubika kwetintsatseli ngalokuhla bako kwakubekana ebu ngotini bekuvalelwa nome kuvalwa kwalolo lushicilelo.

src_text: recently, the organisation reporters without borders published the 2021 world press freedom index, a barometer of the state of media freedom across the globe.
tgt_text: esikhatsini lesisandza kwendlula, inhlangano yabetindzaba ireporters without borders bashicilele inkhomba yekukhululeka kwebetindzaba emhlabeni yanga2021, ibharomitha yesimo senkhululeko yebeti ndzaba emhlabeni wonkhe.

src_text: overall, it was found that there has been a decline in public access to information and an increase in obstacles to news coverage in a number of countries.
tgt_text: jikelele, kutfolakale kutsi kube nekwehla kufinyelela kwemmango kutfola lwatiso kanye nekwenyuka kwetihibe ekubikeni tindza ba emaveni lamanyenti.

src_text: the report said that journalism is "totally blocked or seriously impeded" in 73 countries and "constrained" in 59 others.
tgt_text: lombiko uvete kutsi "umse benti webuntsatseli uvinjwe ngci nome uvinjwe kakhulu" emaveni lange73 kwatsi kulamanye emave lange59 "wacindzetelwa ngenkhani."

src_text: what is worrying is that media freedom has deteriorated under the covid19 pandemic, with the various restrictions put in place having seemingly been used to curtail media activity in several places.
tgt_text: lokukhatsatako kutsi simo senkhululeko yebetindzaba sehle sabasibi kakhulu ngesikhatsi selubhubhane lwecovid19, ngalokuvinjelwa lokwehluka hlukene lokube khona lokubonakale sengatsi kusetjentiselwe kuvimba imisebenti yebetindzaba etindzaweni letinyenti.

src_text: in this latest report south africa ranked 32nd out of 180 countries.
tgt_text: kulombiko wamuva live laseningizimu afrika likleliswe laba le32 emaveni lange180.

src_text: the index describes the state of media freedom in south africa as "guaranteed but fragile".
tgt_text: lenkhomba ichaza simo senkhululeko yebetindzaba kutsi "icinisekisiwe kodvwa intekenteke."

src_text: it notes that while the south african constitution protects freedom and we have an established culture of investigative journalism, a number of impediments still hinder journalists in the performance of their duties.

tgt_text: live lapho khona umtsetfo usetjentiswa ngekulingana kunoma ngusiphi sakhamuti.

src_text: we now have a government of the people, for the people and by the people.
tgt_text: nyalo sesinahulumende we bantfu, lomele bantfu futsi lokhetfwe bantfu.

src_text: when the apartheid regime triumphantly paraded its racist constitution to the world 60 years ago, it had misplaced confidence that it would endure.
tgt_text: lesikhatsi umbuso welu bandlululo ukhombisa ema ve emhlaba ngalokukhulu kutfokota umtsetfosisekelo wawo webuhlanga eminya keni le60 leyengcile, bewu nekutetsemba lokungakafa neli bekutsi utawuhlala ume njalo.

src_text: in an unanswered letter to verwoerd a month before the republic was declared, nelson mandela affirmed the liberation movement’s rejection of the forcibly imposed white republic.
tgt_text: encwadzini lebeyicondzi swe kuverwoerd langaza nge ayiphendvule leyatfu nyelwa kusele inyanga kutsi kumemetelwe iriphabhlikhi, nelson mandela wavuma kutsi umbutfo wenkhululeko angeke uvumele lokubekwe ngenkhani kweriphabhlikhi yebantfu labamhlophe.

src_text: he said that no constitution or form of government decided without the participation of the african people would enjoy moral validity.
tgt_text: watsi kute umtsetfosise kelo noma luhlobo lwahu lumende lolutawubekwa lotawutfola sicinisekiso sekuphatsa lokukahle nga phandle kwekubamba licha za kwebantfu baseafrika.

src_text: indeed no system that entrenches the systematic denial of people’s rights can be sustained.
tgt_text: kuliciniso alukho luhlelo lolungafakwa lelingafuni ku nika bantfu emalungelo lolungasimama.

src_text: though it would be over three decades before the demands of the liberation movement were met, we eventually won our freedom.
tgt_text: nanoma be sekutawuba ngetulu kwemi nyaka lemashumi lamatsatfu ngembi kwekutsi tikhalo tenhlangano yenkhululeko taphumeleliswe, sagcina siyitfolile inkhululeko.

src_text: in relegating the apartheid constitution to the dustbin of history, we committed ourselves to a new constitution and a new set of values.
tgt_text: ngekufaka lomtsetfosise kelo welubandlululo emgco meni wemlandvo, satibo phelela kumtsetfosisekelo lo musha kanye nasetintfweni letimcoka letisha.

src_text: when i addressed the constitutional assembly 25 years ago, i said our constitution must become more than words on a page; it must become a reality in the lives of our people.
tgt_text: lesikhatsi ngetfula inkhu lumo kumkhandlu wemtse tfosisekelo eminyakeni le25 leyengcile, ngatsi umtsetfo sisekelo wetfu kufuneka u ngabi magama lasephepheni kuphela; kufuneka ubeyintfo yangemphela etimphilweni tebantfu betfu.

src_text: unless we do so, this progressive and revolutionary document will be rendered irrelevant and meaningless.
tgt_text: uma singenti njalo, leliphe pha lentfutfuko nale liletsa tingucuko litawutsatfwa njenga lelingenamsebenti nalelingasho lutfo.

src_text: we have long decided what kind of society we want to be.
tgt_text: kudzala satsatsa sincumo sekutsi sifuna kuba ngu mmango lonjani.

src_text: it is a society rooted in human dignity, equality, freedom and nondiscrimination.
tgt_text: simmango logcile ekunikeni sitfunti sebuntfu, ekulinganeni, kunkhululeko nasekunga bandlululani.

src_text: for a quarter of a century we have worked to build such a society.
tgt_text: sikhatsi lesiyikota yemi nyaka lelikhulu besisebenta kwakha ummango lonjena.

src_text: we have made undeniable progress, but we still have many challenges and there is much work still to be done.
tgt_text: sibe nenchubekela embili lengenakuphikiswa, kodvwa sisanetinseyeya letinengi fu tsi kusanemsebenti lomkhu lu lokusafuneka siwente.

src_text: as we mark the anniversary of the adoption of our democratic constitution, let us remember what a decisive break it was with the system underpinned by racism, exploitation, dispossession and oppression that had come before.
tgt_text: njengoba sigubha umkhosi wekwamukelwa kwemtse tfosisekelo wentsandvo yeli nyenti, kufuneka sikhumbu le kutsi kwaba sincumo lesi nemphumelelo lesacedza loluhlelo lobelugcile ku buhlanga, ekucashwatweni, ekutsatselweni imphahla nasekucindzetelweni lobe kukhona phambilini.

src_text: let us also remember that it is up to us to make the vision contained in our constitution a reality.
tgt_text: kufuneka futsi kutsi sikhu mbule kutsi kusemandleni etfu kutsi sente lombono lokumtsetfosisekelo wetfu ube liciniso.

src_text: for it is only by ensuring that all south africans are able to freely and fully exercise their constitutional rights, that we will truly become a united people.
tgt_text: imitamo yeningizimu afrika yekuphumelelisa umbono wemtsetfosisekelo vukuzenzele unnamed eminyakeni lemashu mi asitfupha leye ngcile, mhla ti31 inkhwekhweti 1961, ini ngizimu afrika lebeyine lubandlululo yaba yiripha bhlikhi, yacedza budlelwa no bayo nembuso wase ngilandi.

src_text: the youth are our greatest asset vukuzenzele unnamed on june 16th 1976, the youth of soweto and other parts of the country rose up against the iniquity of bantu education.
tgt_text: insha iligugu letfu lelikhulu kunawo onkhe vukuzenzele unnamed mhla ti16 inhla ba 1976, insha yasesoweto naletinye tincenye telive yasukuma yaphikisana nebubi bemfundvo yebantu labamnyama (ibantu education).

src_text: on that day and in the days that followed, many lost their lives.
tgt_text: ngalelo langa nasemala ngeni lalandzelako, laba ningi balahlekelwa miphe fumulo yabo.

src_text: they were killed by a callous regime that had little regard for black lives and thought nothing of opening fire on unarmed, uniformed schoolchildren.
tgt_text: babulawa ngumbuso lonelunya lobewungenandzaba netimphilo talabamnyama futsi unga cabangi lutfo ngekuvulela ngenhlavu ebantfwaneni besikolo labangakahlomi, bagcoke nenyufomu.

src_text: these events hardened international opinion against the apartheid regime and gave further impetus to the liberation struggle.
tgt_text: letigigaba tacinisa umbono wemave emhlaba ngekumelelana nembuso welubandlu lulo yaphindze yaniketa umfutfo lowengetiwe emshi kashikeni wenkhululeko.

src_text: young people have always been at the forefront of social protest, from the antiauthoritarian protests in latin america in the late 1950s, to the protests across africa in the late 1960s.
tgt_text: ebantfu labasha bebasolo baphambili emibhikishweni lelwa nekuba ngundlovu ayiphikiswa elatin america ngasekupheleni kweminya ka yabo1950, kuya emibhi kishweni eafrika yonkhe ngasekupheleni kweminya ka yabo1960.

src_text: history faithfully records the contribution of the generation of 1976 to the international student movement and its stance against oppression and injustice.
tgt_text: umlandvo ubhalwe ngekutsembeka kwekubanjwa kwelichaza situkulwane sango1976 enhlanganwe ni yebafundzi yemave emhlaba kanye nesincumo saso sokungamelelani nelucindzetelo nekungabi nebu lungiswa.

src_text: this historic event 45 years ago continues to be commemorated across africa and the world.
tgt_text: lengcophamlandvo yesi gigaba leyenteka eminya keni lenge45 lendlulile iyachubeka nekubungatwa eafrika yonkhe nasemhlabeni wonkhe.

src_text: it is therefore disturbing that knowledge of june 16th is diminishing among young south africans.
tgt_text: ngakoke kuyatsikame ta kutsi lwati lwange16 inhlaba luyancipha kulaba sha baseningizimu afrika.

src_text: this is particularly so among the socalled generation z, or young people born between 1997 and 2015. the 2019/2020 south african social attitudes survey published by the human sciences research council found that close to 40% of generation z has not heard of the historical events of june 16th.
tgt_text: loku kunjalo ikakhulukati kulabo lababitwa ngege neration z, kumbe bantfu labasha labatelwe phakatsi kwa1997 na2015.

src_text: a similar percentage has heard about it but knows very little or nothing about it.
tgt_text: luhlolo lwesouth african social attitudes lolukhishwe yihuman science research council lwa2019/2020 lwatfola kutsi cishe emaphesenti lange40 egeneration z awakeva ngemlandvo wetigigaba tange16 inhlaba.

src_text: nevertheless, the survey also found that young people of this generation are open to learning about key historical events and believe in their continued importance.
tgt_text: emaphesenti lafanako avile ngato kodvwa anelwati lo luncane kumbe awati lutfo ngaloko.

src_text: we need to do more as a country to ensure that the message of 1976 is transmitted faithfully.
tgt_text: noma kunjalo, luhlolo luphindze lwatfola kutsi ba ntfu labasha balesitukulwane bavulekile kutsi bafundze ngetigigaba temlandvo letibalulekile futsi bakholelwa ekuchubekeni kwekubalu leka kwato.

src_text: this is a collective responsibility of government, schools, tertiary institutions, parents, families, musicians, artists, and all of society.
tgt_text: sidzinga kwenta lokuni ngi njengelive kute sicinise kise kutsi lomlayeto wa1976 undluliswa ngekweciniso.

src_text: the generation that was born after apartheid ended inherited a country with a democratic constitution and where fundamental freedoms are protected.
tgt_text: loku ngumsebenti lohla nganyelwe nguhulumende, tikolo, tikhungo temfundvo lephakeme, batali, imindeni, baculi, labanetiphiwo leti tsite kanye nawo wonkhe umphakatsi.

src_text: the opportunities young black people have today are both vastly different and greatly improved.
tgt_text: situkulwane lesitelwe ngemuva kwekuphela kwelubandlululo sizuze live lelinemtsetfosisekelo we ntsandvo yelinyenti kanye nalapho inkhululeko lesisekelo ivikeleke khona.

src_text: keeping the story of june 16th alive is a reminder to today’s generation of the great sacrifices made to secure their freedom.
tgt_text: ematfuba bantfu labasha labamnyama labanawo namuhla ahlukahlukene kakhulu futsi atfutfukiswe kakhulu.

src_text: youth day is a reminder of the immense power and agency that young people have to create a better future for themselves.
tgt_text: kugcina indzaba yange16 inhlaba iphila kusikhumbuto esitukulwaneni sana muhla sekutidzela lokukhulu lokwentiwe kuvikela inkhululeko yabo.

src_text: the struggles of young people in south africa today are many.
tgt_text: lusuku lwelusha lusi khumbuto semandla lama khulu futsi luyiejensi bantfu labasha labanayo yekutsi batakhele likusasa lelincono.

src_text: young people have remained at the forefront of activism, whether in pursuit of free education or against social ills like genderbased violence.
tgt_text: imishikashika yebantfu labasha eningizimu afrika namuhla miningi kakhulu.

src_text: today the greatest struggle young people wage is against unemployment, which has worsened under the covid19 pandemic.
tgt_text: bantfu labasha bahleti pha mbili emishikashikeni, noma yekufuna imfundvo yama hhala kumbe lemelene ne bubi bemphakatsi njengelu dlame lolubhekiswe kubulili lobutsite.

src_text: creating more opportunities for young people, and access to these opportunities, is government’s foremost priority.
tgt_text: namuhla umshikashika lomkhulu bantfu labasha labalwa nawo kuswelakala kwemisebenti, lokube kubi kakhulu ngaphasi kwelu bhubhane lwecovid19.

src_text: everything that we do as a government contributes towards improving the lives of young people.
tgt_text: kwakhela bantfu labasha ematfuba lamaningi, nekufinyelela kulawo matfuba, yintfo lephambili kuhulumende.

src_text: tackling youth unemployment requires accelerating economic growth, particularly in labourintensive sectors, and building the capability of the state to fulfil its developmental role.
tgt_text: konkhe lesikwentako nje ngahulumende kunelichaza ekutfutfukiseni timphilo tebantfu labasha.

src_text: we are also driving this agenda through targeted interventions.
tgt_text: kubukana nekungasebenti kwalabasha kudzinga kutsi kuphangiswe kukhuliswa kwemnotfo, ika khulukati emikhakheni ledzinga basebenti labaningi, kanye nekwakha emandla embuso ekufeza indzima yawo yentfutfuko.

src_text: these include the presidential employment stimulus, which has provided work opportunities and livelihoods support for many young people.
tgt_text: sibuye sichube loluhlelo ngekungenelela lokuhlosiwe.

src_text: we have launched a range of additional measures to create opportunities, enhance skills development, support young entrepreneurs and enable the full participation of young people in the economy.
tgt_text: loku kufaka ekhatsi luhlelo lwamengameli lwekuvula ematfuba emisebenti, lesivule ematfuba emisebenti nekusekelwa kwemphilo yebantfu labasha labaningi.

src_text: this includes the establishment of a national pathway management network, sa youth, to make it easier for young people to view and access opportunities and receive active support to find pathways into the labour market.
tgt_text: setfule luhla lwetinyatse lo letengetiwe tekwakha ematfuba, kuchubekisa kutfutfukisa kwemakhono, kusekela bosomabhizinisi labasafufusa kanye nekusita bantfu labasha kutsi baba mbe lichaza emnotfweni.

src_text: these are among the priorities of the presidential youth employment intervention, which was launched just weeks before we entered a national lockdown last year and which is now entering full implementation.
tgt_text: loku kufaka ekhatsi kusungulwa kwenational pathway management ne twork, isa youth, kuze kutsi kube lula ebantfwini labasha kubuka nekutfola ematfuba kanye nekutfola kusekelwa lokusebentako kokungena emakethe yebasebenti.
